note: A wide-ranging study of antitheatrical attitudes from Plato to the twentieth century.
title: A classic study of Renaissance imitatio, with a discussion of ancient theories 7222 and illuminating readings of works by Petrarch, Erasmus and others
The Antitheatrical Prejudice
Unmaking Mimesis, London and New York: Routledge. Influential essays on the intersection between traditional theories of mimesis and the practice of feminist theatre
Absorption and Theatricality
An important account of the ways eighteenth-century painters reconfigured the relationship between painting and the beholder by turning against theatricality
Performance Theory, London and New York: Routledge. Intellectually challenging essays on cross-cultural ideas about theatre by one of the founders of performance studies
Mimesis
Classic study of Western realism from Homer and the Bible to Virginia Woolf

Art and Illusion, Princeton NJ: Princeton University Press. Somewhat dated but still illuminating study of artistic realism that draws on scientific accounts of perception and cognition to explain how we recognize the real in art
Realism
Accessible discussion of pictorial realism and the realist movement in nineteenth-century painting
The Order of Mimesis, Cambridge: Cambridge University Press. Incisive critical discussion of mimesis, along with readings of works by nineteenth-century realist writers such as Balzac and Stendhal
The Freudian Subject
Dense and difficult, but influential, discussion of Freud’s theory of identification
